section.title: Administrator
section.p: A privileged user role within an organization with the permission to manage the organization's account and subscriptions as well as its users and their roles. Each organization has at least one administrator.

section.title: Application
section.p: A software, including procedures and documentation, which performs productive tasks for users.

section.title: Billing System
section.p: A system responsible for calculating the charges for using a service.

section.title: Broker
section.p: An organization which supports suppliers in establishing relationships to customers by offering the suppliers' services on a marketplace, as well as a privileged user role within such an organization.

section.title: Cloud
section.p: A metaphor for the Internet and an abstraction of the underlying infrastructure it conceals.

section.title: Cloud Computing
section.p: The provisioning of dynamically scalable and often virtualized resources as a service over the Internet on a utility basis.

section.title: Customer
section.p: An organization which subscribes to one or more marketable services in in order to use the underlying applications in the Cloud.

section.title: Infrastructure as a Service (IaaS)
section.p: The delivery of computer infrastructure (typically a platform virtualization environment) as a service.

section.title: Marketable Service
section.p: A service offering to customers in , based on a technical service. A marketable service defines prices, conditions, and restrictions for using the underlying application.

section.title: Marketplace
section.p: A virtual platform for suppliers, brokers, and resellers in to provide their services to customers.

section.title: Marketplace Owner
section.p: An organization which holds a marketplace in , where one or more suppliers, brokers, or resellers can offer their marketable services.

section.title: Marketplace Manager
section.p: A privileged user role within a marketplace owner organization.

section.title: OIDC
section.p: An authentication mode of where users are managed and authenticated by means of OpenID Connect in an external system such as Microsoft Azure Active Directory, the so-called OIDC provider.

section.title: OIDC Tenant
section.p: An entity in representing a configuration of settings and parameters required to connect to a specific tenant at an OIDC provider, for example, a specific domain and directory in Microsoft Azure Active Directory.

section.title: Operator
section.p: An organization or person responsible for maintaining and operating .

section.title: Organization
section.p: An organization typically represents a company, but it may also stand for a department of a company or a single person. An organization has a unique account and ID, and is assigned one or more of the following roles: technology provider, supplier, customer, broker, reseller, marketplace owner, operator.

section.title: Organizational Unit
section.p: A set of one or more users within an organization representing, for example, a department in a company, an individual project, a cost center, or a single person. A user may be assigned to one or more organizational units.

A privileged user role within an organization allowing a user to manage the organizational units for which he has been appointed as an administrator, and to create, modify, and terminate subscriptions for these units.

section.title: Payment Type
section.p: A specification of how a customer may pay for the usage of his subscriptions. The operator defines the payment types available in ; the supplier or reseller determines which payment types are offered to his customers, for example payment on receipt of invoice, direct debit, or credit card.

section.title: Platform as a Service (PaaS)
section.p: The delivery of a computing platform and solution stack as a service.

section.title: Price Model
section.p: A specification for a marketable service defining whether and how much customers subscribing to the service will be charged for the subscription as such, each user assigned to the subscription, specific events, or parameters and their options.

section.title: Reseller
section.p: An organization which offers services defined by suppliers to customers applying its own terms and conditions, as well as a privileged user role within such an organization.

section.title: Role
section.p: A collection of authorities that control which actions can be carried out by an organization or user to whom the role is assigned.

section.title: Seller
section.p: Collective term for supplier, broker, and reseller organizations.

section.title: Service
section.p: Generally, a discretely defined set of contiguous or autonomous business or technical functionality, for example an infrastructure or Web service. distinguishes between technical services and marketable services, and uses the term "service" as a synonym for "marketable service".

section.title: Service Manager
section.p: A privileged user role within a supplier organization.

section.title: Standard User
section.p: A non-privileged user role within an organization.

section.title: Software as a Service (SaaS)
section.p: A model of software deployment where a provider licenses an application to customers for use as a service on demand.

section.title: Subscription
section.p: An agreement registered by a customer for a marketable service in . By subscribing to a service, the customer is given access to the underlying application under the conditions defined in the marketable service.

section.title: Subscription Manager
section.p: A privileged user role within an organization with the permission to create and manage his own subscriptions.

section.title: Supplier
section.p: An organization which defines marketable services in for offering applications provisioned by technology providers to customers.

section.title: Technical Service
section.p: The representation of an application in . A technical service describes parameters and interfaces of the underlying application and is the basis for one or more marketable services.

section.title: Technology Manager
section.p: A privileged user role within a technology provider organization.

section.title: Technology Provider
section.p: An organization which provisions applications as technical services in .
